result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis A Owens

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquis A Owens in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Marquis A Owens.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. 
Defense counsel requested additional time to review with defendant. Court grants request.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Obscherning appeared in Court via Zoom confirming if the 10/13/2022 plea/sentencing hearing will be held in person. Court reschedules plea/sentencing to 10/13/2022 at 3:30 p.m. in Room 620 of the Safety Building to accommodate.

Defendant Marquis A Owens in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marquis A Owens in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense has discovery and offer from the State and requests a status conference. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marquis A Owens in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant attempted to get in contact with the State Public Defender's Office but was unsuccessful. Case passed to make contact with SPD office.
Case recalled at 9:25am. Defendant advised court that he is public defender eligible. Case adjourned back to branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquis A Owens in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquis A Owens appeared by video means.  HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. 
Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.Court refers defendant to PUBLIC DEFENDER.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 This hearing will be be held in person.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (4/7/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Marquis A Owens in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant Declined Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/5/22 @ 1:30p
